customer_addr:
S 2104 EAGLE VIEW LANE
WESTBY, WI 54667

citations.narrative:
Two enclosures were too small for the dogs the contained. One enclosure contained five weaned puppies between 2-4
months of age. The puppies measured 15 inches, 17 inches, 19 inches, 21 inches, and 21 inches respectively. Together
these puppies required 3,053 square inches of space. The enclosure measured 26.5 by 46.5 inches for a total of 1,232.25
square inches of space. The enclosure was short by 1,820.75 square inches of space.
Another enclosure contained two adult dogs that measured 20 inches and 23 inches respectively. Together they required
1,517 square inches of space. The enclosure measured 27.5 by 46.5 inches for a total of 1,278.75 square inches of
space. The enclosure was short by 238.25 square inches of space.
Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures. It
minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee
must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure.
Correct starting on 3/18/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
3.6(c)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Two enclosures were too small for the dogs the contained. One enclosure contained five weaned puppies between 2-4 
months of age. The puppies measured 15 inches, 17 inches, 19 inches, 21 inches, and 21 inches respectively. Together 
these puppies required 3,053 square inches of space. The enclosure measured 26.5 by 46.5 inches for a total of 1,232.25 
square inches of space. The enclosure was short by 1,820.75 square inches of space. 
 
Another enclosure contained two adult dogs that measured 20 inches and 23 inches respectively. Together they required 
1,517 square inches of space. The enclosure measured 27.5 by 46.5 inches for a total of 1,278.75 square inches of 
space. The enclosure was short by 238.25 square inches of space. 
 
Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures. It 
minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee 
must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space 
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure. 
 
Correct starting on 3/18/25. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n
